result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric R. Scheffler

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 10:05am
INCLUDES 15CM888 & 15CM1621
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner. Deft appears with Atty Amanda Ley

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
15CM888:
Ct. 1 Disorderly Conduct- domestic abuse >> D&RI
15CM1621:
Ct. 2 Knowingly violate domestic abuse order- injunction- domestic abuse >> D&RI
Ct. 5 Computer message- threaten/obscennity- domestic abuse >> D&RI
Ct. 6 Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor >> D&RI
Ct. 7 Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor >> D&RI
Ct. 8 Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor >> D&RI
Ct. 9 Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor >> D&RI
COURT grants above
PLEA: 
15CM1621:
Ct. 1 Knowingly violate domestic abuse order- injunction- domestic abuse >> NO CONTEST
Ct. 3 Disorderly Conduct- domestic abuse >> NO CONTEST 
Ct. 4 Resisting or obstructing an officer >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises deft of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: w/hold sentencing. 1 year probation, concurrent. CONDITIONS: Complete SAFE intake program with follow through. Complete any other assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Pay CC. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. Pay 2 domestic abuse surcharges. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two, when not fully engaged complete 9 hours of community service per week. No possession of dangerous weapons. No contact with S.X. unless approved by agent. Cash bond posted returned to poster.

Atty Ley to provide stipulation of jail credit to court if applicable

Adj: 10:21am
and Certificate of Appearance (subpoena served on S.X. on 5/11/16)
Plea hearing on May 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.
State's Notice Regarding Defendant's Statements - stj

Pre-trial conference at 03-08-2016 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial at 04-05-2016 04:00 pm.
Jury Trial at 05-17-2016 08:30 am.

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 9:22am
INCLUDES 15CM888 & 15CM1621
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner.  Deft appears in person with Atty Amanda Ley.
Date and time set for plea and sentencing 

State says there is no agreement at this time and matter to be set on jury trial calender
Atty Ley agrees with setting on jury trial
COURT tells parties to meet with Br 1 JA to get set on jury trial

Adj: 9:23am
Request For Adjournment of Jury Trial - granted

ADDRESS INFO for Eric R. Scheffler
Current: 1501 Wisconsin St., Wausau, WI 54403 United States  (Effective: 07-20-2015)
Prior: 2341 Fawn Road Lot #69, Mosinee, WI 54455

Pre-trial conference on June 26, 2015 at 10:10 am.
Final pre-trial on August 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury Trial on September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No contact with victim(s): S.X. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings. 3rd party visitation through Family Resource Center.
